intro: Pilosella schultesii subsp. pictisquama, commonly known as the painted pincushion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or subalpine regions. Its subspecies name, *pictisquama*, refers to the distinctive, colorful markings on its bracts. It is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
